alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:50PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn and Sheridan Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 548 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms across Sheridan County, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Public and radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton, Big Horn, Clearmont, Leiter, Wyola, Arvada, Tongue River Reservoir, Parkman and Banner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for south central and southeastern Montana...and north central Wyoming.
